chargeHist.descr: Battery to Law Enforcement Officers, Fire Fighters or Commission Wardens
Battery to Law Enforcement Officers, Fire Fighters or Commission Wardens

result.execSummary:
The defendant Thomas J Pfaffl was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Huber with standard release conditions.  Sentence Credit for 2 days granted if revoked.

miscConds.notes: Bail applied to costs.   Any remaing bail to be refunded to poster.

Submit to an AODA assessment, follow through with any treatment recommended.  No use or possession of illegal controlled substance. Comply with random urine screens.  Maintain absolute sobriety. Inform Agent of all Prescriptions.  Sign release for Agent.  Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent.

No violent contact with Dayna D.
  Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided,   immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.
  If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.
Defendant is not to possess any weapons/firearms.

timeConds.notes: Non-Working Hours-Release for work and treatment.  To commence November 9, 2015 at 12:00 p.m.

with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.
treatment

Defendant Thomas J Pfaffl in court with attorney Nicole M Masnica.  Stephen Joseph Centinario appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  State files an amended information to amend count #1.  Defendant pleads guilty to count #1.  Court finds the defendant guilty of count #1.  Counts 2,3 and 4 are dismissed and read in.  State makes recommendations.  Attorney Masnica makes statements.  Defendant makes statements.  
The Court Orders the Following:  Count #1

Imposed and Stayed Sentence of:
6 month Huber with STANDARD RELEASE CONDITIONS.  (Credit - 2 days).  
Term of Probation:  1 Year
Conditions of Probation:
AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended;
Absolute Sobriety; Random U.A.s;
No Use or Possession of illegal controlled substance.  
Inform agent of all prescriptions;
Sign Release for Agent;
Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent;
No violent contact with Dayna D.
Provide DNA sample if not yet provided  and pay surcharge
Defendant is not to possess any weapons/firearms.
Condition Time: 5 days Huber with work and treatment release, NON WORKING HOURS - To commence November 9, 2015 @ noon.  
COSTS:  $243.00 Bail to be applied
DNA Surcharge: $200.00  Bail to be applied
Remainder of the bail posted to be refunded to the poster.  
DNA Sample ordered and to be provided immediately if in custody or within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.
